Es como hablar a una pared: It’s like talking to a brick wall
Eso dicen: So they say. Learning english is easy, or so they say
Cuantos más mejor: The more the better | The more the merrier
No te pongas así: Don’t be like that. Behave well, don’t be like that
No te lo tomes a pecho: Don’t take it seriously | Don’t take it to heart
Empezar con buen pie: Get off to a (good | flying) start.
Así me vale: That’ll do. I don’t want any more chocolate, that’ll do
Estoy agobiado: I’m overwhelmed | stressed | snowed under | swamped
No me malinterpretes: Don’t misunderstand me | Don’t take me wrong
Tener la sartén por el mango: To be in control | Call the shots | Crack the whip (I hate to crack the whip, but it’s kind of business meeting time)
Tiene que ver con: It has to do with something
¡Qué casualidad!: What a coincidence! What are the chances?
En la cuerda floja: To be on thin ice | walk a tightrope | in the balance (your life hangs in the balance)
Te lo tienes merecido: It serves you right | You had it coming
Estar contra las cuerdas: To be up against the ropes | To be on the ropes
No tener pelos en la lengua: Not mince your words (You’ve never been one to mince words) | Speak your mind (It takes courage to speak your mind)
A la tercera va la vencida: Third time’s a charm | Third time lucky
Te guste o no: Whether you like it or not
Parecer un disco rayado: To sound like a broken record
Ver el lado positivo: To look on the bright side
Querer es poder: Where there’s a will, there’s a way
Salir el tiro por la culata: Backfire | Shoot yourself in the foot
Me da pereza: I can’t be bothered | I can’t be arsed
Si no me equivoco: If I’m not mistaken | If I’m not wrong
Ir por buen camino: To be on the right track
No hay mal que por bien no venga: Every cloud has a silver lining
¡Qué lástima!: What a shame | What a pity
En la punta de la lengua: On the tip of my tongue
Las apariencias engañan: Don’t judge a book by its cover
¡Cuidado!: Be careful! Watch out! Look out!
Tener mucha energía: To be full of beans | He’s very active
Dar en el clavo: Hit the nail on the head
Por los pelos: By the skin of your teeth
Lanzarse a la piscina: To jump in at the deep end
Costar un ojo de la cara: Cost an arm and a leg
Aprovechar: Make the most of | Take advantage of
Ir al grano: Get to the point | Cut to the chase
Está jarreando: It’s (pouring | pissing | chucking | lashing) It down
Tener una corazonada: To have a hunch / To have a feeling
De tal palo tal astilla: The apple doesn’t fall far from the tree | like father like son-daughter | Personally I think I’ve taken after my dad
Me he quedado sin palabras: I’m speechless | I’m at a loss for words | I’m lost for words
Para el carro: Hold your horses | Wait | Hold on | Hang on
Entre la espada y la pared: Between a rock and a hard place
Me hago pipí: I need a wee | I need to do a #1 | I need to loo
Se me han puesto los pelos de punta: Give me (goosebumps | the creeps |  the shivers) Make my hairs stand on end
Metí la pata: I messed up | I screwed up | I put my foot in my mouth
Hacer borrón y cuenta nueva: To start over with a clean slate
Herding cats: An idiom denoting a futile attempt to control or organize a class of entities which are inherently uncontrollable
Reorganizar/Reestructurar: Reswizzle. To rearrange or reorganize or restructure something in a useful, relevant way.
Además de eso: In addition to that, on top of that, besides that
Se volvió loco: He went bananas | He went mad
Es muy listo: He’s a smart cookie | He’s very smart
El es muy importante: He is the big cheese | He’s very important
Tengo cosas más importantes que hacer: I have a bigger fish to fry | I’ve more important things to do
Calmarse: To put yourself together | To calm down
Estar indeciso: To be on the fence | To be undecided about something
Deshacerse de los malos sentimientos: Shake it off | To get rid of bad feelings or negative emotions
Hacer algo extra: To go the extra mile | To do something extra
Acabar malamente: To go down in flames | To end badly
El secreto ha salido a la luz: The cat’s out of the bag | The secret is out
Contar un secreto: Spill the tea | Tell a secret
No abandones: Hang in there | Don’t give up
En buen estado de salud: Alive and kicking | In good health
Estoy calmado: I’m cool as a cucumber | I’m calm
Algo está mal: I smell a rat | Something is wrong
Una situación cómoda: A bed of roses | A comfortable situation
Me gustas mucho: I’m so into you | I like you a lot
Deja de perder el tiempo: Stop faffing around | Stop wasting your time
Guardar un secreto: Keep it a secret | Keep it under wraps
Tienes mucha suerte: You’re so jammy | You’re so lucky
Estoy muy ocupado: I’ve got a lot on my plate | I’m swamped | I am very busy
Te escucho atentamente: I’m all ears | I’m listening carefully
Mándame un mensaje: Text me | Shoot me a message
Ya me decidí: I made up my mind | I decided
Me lo pensaré: I’ll think about it | I’ll sleep on it
¿Qué dijiste?: Come again | What did you say
¿Qué estás haciendo?: What are you up to? | What are you doing?
Me haces reir: You  make me laugh | You crack me up
No es tan dificil: It’s not so difficult | It’s not rocket science
No, gracias: No thank you | I’m all set
No lo entiendo: I don’t understand | I don’t get it
Estoy de acuerdo contigo: I agree with you | We are on the same page
No me lo creo: I don’t believe it | I’m not buying it
Es una decisión fácil: That’s an easy call | Tha’s an easy decision
Ha pasado mucho tiempo: It’s been long time | It’s been donkey’s years
Me estás molestando mucho: You’re taking the biscuit | You’re really annoying me
Cállate: Shut up | Put a sock in it | Zip it
Estoy muy contento: I’m so pleased | I'm chuffed to bits
Está teniendo una pataleta: He’s having a tantrum | He’s throwing a wobbly
Hace frío fuera: It’s brass monkeys outside | It’s cold outside
Eso es muy barato: That’s cheap as chips | That’s really cheap
No me importa: I don’t care | I don’t give a monkey’s
Hasta luego: See you in a bit | See you later
Tengo gripe: I get the flu | I come down with the flu
Me he recuperado de la gripe: I recovered from the flu | I got over the flu
Me siento deprimido: I get down | I feel depressed
Me dormí sin querer: I dozed off | I fall asleep without intending
Comí demasiado: I’m stuffed | I ate too much
Soy extrovertido: I'm outgoing | I am a people person
Me gusta estar en casa: I’m a homebody | I like to stay at home
Me gusta hablar mucho: I’m a chatterbox | I like to talk a lot
Soy muy sociable: I am a social butterfly | I am very social
No me gusta gastar dinero: I am a cheapskate | I don’t like spending money
Soy un cobarde: I’m a wimp | I lack confidence
Dificil de creer: Hard to swallow | Difficult to believe
Disponible para todo el mundo: Up for grabs | Available to anyone
Estoy en problemas: I’m in hot water | I’m in trouble
Estoy teniendo suerte: I’m on a roll | I’m having a lucky period
Estoy concentrado siendo productivo: I’m in the zone | I am focused and productive
Sentirse un poco enfermo: To be a bit under the weather
Una situación se aclarará con el tiempo: It will come out in the wash
Algo impresionante: the bee’s knees. My dancing is the bee’s knees
